Description: PC *_katɨ_ ‘fat’. Note that some languages reinterpreted the final syllable as a PERT marker.
Tupian ‘fat’. It is not clear if all forms are cognate.
Tupian ‘father’. Incidentally, one of the forms with initial PT *Dj; lost in Tupari and reanalyzed in Aweti-Guarani. See [TuLaR: 5755](https://tular.clld.org/cognatesets/5755).
Tupian ‘to give’. Not attested in MAG, but Munduruku. No other cognates found.
Tupian ‘leaf’. Incidentally, one of the forms with initial PT *Dj.
Tupinamba and Tuparí ‘payment’. No other cognates found.
Tupian ‘to say’. Not cognate with t-say-2 according to [TuLaR](https://tular.clld.org/cognatesets/13811).
Tupari and Mekens ‘to say’. Not cognate with t-say-1 according to [TuLaR](https://tular.clld.org/cognatesets/13816).
Tupian ‘to take’. Though no PTG form has been reconstructed, syllable-final PTG \*r is instead reconstructed as \*t by Meira & Drude. Maybe *_jat_?
